wikipedia_page.main: James Platt (1823 – 27 August 1857) was a British Radical politician and manufacturer.

response: Platt's younger brother James Platt (1824–1857), helped build the firm and was active in promoting working-class adult education in Oldham, especially the Oldham Lyceum, he was elected MP for Oldham in 1857, but died the same year.

link_mentions.page: Records of members of parliament of the United Kingdom

response: Platt's younger brother James Platt (1824–1857) was also elected MP for Oldham in 1857, but was killed that same year in Greenfield at Ashway Gap on Saddleworth Moor by an accidental discharge of the gun of Josiah Radcliffe, the Mayor of Oldham.The Oldham Chronicle, August 29 1857 - Melancholy and Untimely death of James Platt, Esq, M.P.
